translation: He bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet, circumambulated him three times, wept in tears, and withdrew home.

source_sentence: 「時，降怨王聞然燈佛來蓮華城，及於無量聲聞比丘百千之眾，皆是漏盡大阿羅漢，
translation: Having heard that the Buddha Candracchattra had come to the city of Padmavṛṣavyūha, King Sudarśana and hundreds of thousands of śrāvaka bhikṣus were all great arhats who had completely extinguished the influence of defilement.

source_sentence: 聞已喜歡，嚴治道路，所有雜穢，悉使耘除，挍飾莊嚴，如上所說，乃至等彼乾闥婆城，
translation: Having heard it, they liked it and adorned the roads. All the dirt that was on the roads cleaned them up and their embellishments were as described above, even to the same extent as those of the city of Gandhāra.

source_sentence: 一種無異。
translation: There's no difference between one kind and another.

source_sentence: 時降怨王出勅告示：『其城內外十二由旬，禁斷一切所有人民，不聽私賣諸香花鬘，
translation: The king of the conquerors then issued an edict, saying, 'Twelve leagues inside and outside that city, all the citizens were forbidden from selling incense, flowers, garlands, or perfumes.

source_sentence: 其有之處，我自採買，欲持供養彼然燈佛。』
translation: Where there is one, I'll pick it up and buy it myself, wanting to carry it and make offerings to the buddha Rājagṛha.'

source_sentence: 時降怨王將四種兵，具大威德，從城而出，迎然燈佛。
translation: The king who had conquered the enemy, armed with four kinds of troops and endowed with great majestic virtue, came out of the city to meet Randana Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛本行集經受決定記品第二上
translation: The Second Chapter of the Sutra on the Collection of the Original Acts of the Buddha and the Acceptance of Determined Records

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼國雪山南面有一梵志，名曰珍寶，父母清淨婆羅門種，乃至先祖七世已來，
translation: “At the time, there was a priest named Zhenbao on the southern side of the Himalayas in that country. His parents were pure brāhmaṇas and his ancestors had been religious practitioners for seven generations.

source_sentence: 不曾雜穢，無有人能輙敢譏毀。
translation: It has never been defiled, and no one dared criticize it.

source_sentence: 然其種姓皆為智者之所讚譽，又為其餘諸導師等之所恭敬，三種行具，
translation: They are praised by wise people and revered by other teachers. Their practices are endowed with three kinds:

source_sentence: 能教一切毘陀之論，四種毘陀皆悉收盡。
translation: He was able to teach all the theories of the Vedas, and he collected all four kinds of Vedas.

source_sentence: 又闡陀論，字論，聲論，及可笑論，呪術之論，受記之論，世間相論，
translation: Also there is the treatise on icchantika, the treatise on syllables, the treatise on sounds, and the treatise on laughable things. There is the treatise on magic spells, the treatise on receiving predictions, and the treatise on worldly characteristics.

source_sentence: 世間祭祀呪願之論，具足備有大丈夫相，自生善家。
translation: Worldly rituals, spells, vows, and treatises are fully endowed with the characteristics of a great person who is born in a good home.

source_sentence: 復有五百善姓家兒，為其弟子，圍繞供承。
translation: Again, there were five hundred sons of a good family who surrounded and honored him as his disciples.

source_sentence: 阿難當知！
translation: Ānanda, you should know!

source_sentence: 爾時，珍寶婆羅門者，現今彌勒菩薩是也。
translation: At the time, the treasured Brahman was the present-day Maitreya Bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 時，彼五百諸弟子等常從是師，讀誦祭祀呪術之法。
translation: At the time, those five hundred disciples always followed this teacher and recited the ritual dhāraṇī spells.

source_sentence: 時彼五百弟子之中，有一大姓婆羅門子，號名為雲，於彼眾中，而作上首，
translation: Among those five hundred disciples, there was a man named Yun, a great brahman boy by the name of Vaiśravaṇa, who became the chief among them.

source_sentence: 眾行具足，少小從師。
translation: The monks were well versed in all the disciplinary rules and disciplines, with few minor disciples following their teachers.

source_sentence: 時年十六，端政可憙，得善種生，父母清淨，乃至七世，無有穢濁，無能譏呵，
translation: When he was sixteen years old, he looked handsome and dignified. He was born from a good family line and his parents were pure. For seven generations no one could criticize him or criticize him.

source_sentence: 其家種族，乃至具足大丈夫相，世間無比，身黃金色，頭髮亦然，其聲清淨，
translation: Their families and clans are all endowed with the characteristics of a great being, incomparable to anyone in the world. Their bodies are golden-colored, their hair is also like this, and their voices are clear and pure.

source_sentence: 如梵天音。
translation: It's like the sound of Brahmā.

source_sentence: 從彼珍寶仙人之邊，受誦呪術，捷利速疾，所得真正，一聞便領，語言辯了，
translation: At the side of that holy man Jeweled One, he recited a spell to enchant him. He was so quick-witted and swift-witted that when he heard it he could comprehend it at once; his words were eloquent and clear.

source_sentence: 字句分明。
translation: The words and phrases are clearly expressed.

source_sentence: 所有一切婆羅門家，種種呪術，工巧技能，皆悉洞解。
translation: All the various spells, arts, crafts, and skills of all the brāhmaṇas’ houses were completely enlightened.

source_sentence: 解已語彼梵志師言：『大師和上！
translation: After understanding it, he said to the priestly teacher, 'Great master!

source_sentence: 我今習學，已盡和上所有德術，意欲還家。』
translation: Now that I've studied it, I've exhausted the skillful means of virtue possessed by the superior and want to return home.'

source_sentence: 其和上心戀雲童子，不欲別離，即語之言：『汝摩那婆！
translation: That monk was deeply attached to the boy Yun and didn't want to part with him, so he spoke to him, saying, 'You Manabha!

source_sentence: 我有一論，名為毘陀，乃是往昔諸仙所說，一切外道婆羅門等，未曾知聞，
translation: I have a treatise named the Vedas, which was taught by all the sages of the past. All heretics and brahmans have never heard it before.

source_sentence: 況復得見及以教他？』
translation: How could it be possible to see and teach others?'

source_sentence: 摩那婆言：『唯願和上，為我解說。』
translation: Manabha said, 'Please, Bhagavān, explain it for me.'

source_sentence: 「時，彼梵志即復更教彼摩那婆祕要呪術。
translation: “Then, that priest then again taught him the secret dhāraṇī of manapāda.

source_sentence: 時，摩那婆亦悉受得，復更重白彼梵志言：『我今已得和上呪術方法盡解，
translation: Again, Mānava again repeatedly said to the brahmin, “I have now mastered the method of magical spells.

source_sentence: 復更何作？』
translation: What else should I do?'

source_sentence: 梵志復告摩那婆言：『我婆羅門種姓相承，復有家法：若有弟子，從師學問，
translation: Again, the brahmin said to Manabha, “O Mānava, we brāhmaṇas are naturally born into a pure family line.

source_sentence: 必須報恩，將諸財物以用布施。』
translation: You must repay kindness and give your possessions as alms.'

source_sentence: 摩那婆言：『和上為我解說家法，將何報恩？
translation: Mānavava said, 'Sir, what kindness will you repay for explaining the family's teaching to me?'

source_sentence: 和上今心欲須何等？』
translation: What's the need for the present mental state of Vaiśravaṇa?'

source_sentence: 梵志語言：『汝摩那婆！
translation: The priest said, 'You Manabha!

source_sentence: 欲報我者，可將一好清淨傘蓋、革屣、金杖，金三叉木，金瓶，金鉢，
translation: Those who wish to repay me should bring a fine and pure umbrella, leather sandals, a golden staff, three-pronged wood made of gold, a golden vase, or a golden bowl.

source_sentence: 上下舍勒，五百金錢，如是與我。』
translation: Up and down, Śāriputra, give me five hundred coins like this.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，童子白梵志言：『和上大師！
translation: It was then that the boy said to the priest, 'Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 我無如上所說之物可奉和上，請乞放我，四方求索，得即將來供養和上。』
translation: I don't have anything like the above-explained things to offer to the monk, ask for permission to release me, and beg in all directions to make offerings to the monk.'

source_sentence: 梵志報言：『汝若知時，當隨所去。』
translation: The priest replied, 'If you know the time, you'll go wherever you are.'

source_sentence: 時雲童子，頂禮師足，圍繞三匝辭別而行。
translation: The boy Yun then bowed his head at the teacher's feet, circumambulated him three times, and departed.

source_sentence: 時雲童子，聞有一處，去此雪山五百由旬，其城名為輸羅波奢，時彼城內有一種姓大婆羅門，
translation: Then the youthful Yun heard that there was a place five hundred yojanas away from this snowy mountain, called Śūrapāśa. There was a great brahman of one caste living in that city.

source_sentence: 名祭祀德，居住彼城。
translation: They're called the virtue of sacrifice and they live in that city.

source_sentence: 彼婆羅門大富饒財，甚足資產。
translation: That Brāhmaṇa was very wealthy and possessed a great deal of property.

source_sentence: 彼祭祀德大婆羅門，欲為六萬諸婆羅門，奉設一年無遮之會，備辦六萬布施之具，
translation: That great brahman of sacrificial virtue wished to establish a one-yearly unobstructed assembly for the sake of sixty thousand brahmans, who would prepare sixty thousand articles of almsgiving.

source_sentence: 為一一人，人一傘蓋、一三叉木、革屣瓶鉢、上下舍勒，及錢物等，供身之具，
translation: For the sake of one person, a person is offered an umbrella, a trident, wooden cloth, leather bowls, vases, bowls, bowls and bowls, as well as all kinds of money and other things.

source_sentence: 皆悉備足。
translation: They are all fully endowed.

source_sentence: 別為上座一婆羅門，造於金柄上妙傘蓋，最勝革屣，純金為杖，金三叉拒，
translation: He had a specially decorated canopy of the finest quality with a golden handle, made of superior leather; pure gold for his staff and three-pronged bow of gold.

source_sentence: 金瓶金鉢，上下舍勒。
translation: A golden vase and a golden bowl, up and down Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 價數各直百千兩金，五百金錢，一千牸牛，各并犢子，一牛一[(殼-一)\/牛]得一斗乳，
translation: Their value each was worth hundreds of thousands of taels of gold, five hundred coins, one thousand sheep and cows, each with a calf. Each cow gained one sheng of milk for the price of [one sheep].

source_sentence: 其牛角上，皆以金裝。
translation: On the horns of the cow, they're all adorned with gold.

source_sentence: 五百童女，皆珠瓔珞，莊嚴其身；
translation: Their bodies were embellished with five hundred girls, all adorned with jewel necklaces.

source_sentence: 其諸女中有一童女，名曰善技，最為上首，其般遮會年歲已滿，唯一日在。
translation: Among those women, there was a young woman named Shanqi, the most prominent among them all. The duration of the pāñcika assembly was only one day in length when she had passed away.

source_sentence: 「時，雲童子從雪山下，安庠而至輸羅波城無遮會所。
translation: “At that time, the boy Yun came from the foot of the Himalayas and settled in peace. He reached the city of Śrāvastī, where there was an unobstructed assembly.

source_sentence: 時彼六萬諸婆羅門，遙見童子，即發大聲唱言：『善哉！
translation: When 60,000 Brāhmaṇas saw the boy from a distance, they raised their voices and called out, 'Good!'

source_sentence: 是處善造此般遮會，今梵天至，自來受此般遮布施。』
translation: This is the place where this parinirvāṇa assembly was well-constructed, and now that the Brahma gods have arrived, they've come to receive this parinirvāṇa almsgiving from themselves.'

source_sentence: 時雲童子語彼六萬婆羅門言：『汝等莫喚我作梵天，我是於人，實非梵天。』
translation: The boy Yun then said to the 60,000 Brāhmaṇas, 'Don't call me Brahmā; I am a human being and really not Brahmā.'

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：『汝是阿誰？』
translation: The Brāhmaṇa said, 'Who are you?'

source_sentence: 雲童子言：『汝可不聞，雪山南面，有一梵志，名曰珍寶，種種通達，
translation: On the southern side of the snow-capped mountain is a brahmin named Jewel, endowed with all kinds of supernormal knowledge.

source_sentence: 教授門徒五百弟子，乃至如上次第所說。
translation: He taught his disciples and five hundred disciples, up to the point where they were taught in order as above.

source_sentence: 彼眾之中有一上足弟子，名雲，年始十六，智慧聰明，德術具足，與師無異，
translation: Among them was a learned disciple named Yun, who was sixteen years old. Endowed with wisdom and intelligence, endowed with virtue and skillfulness, he was no different from his teacher.

source_sentence: 乃至其聲如梵天音。
translation: Its sound is like that of the Brahma gods.

source_sentence: 汝等聞不？』
translation: Have you heard it?'

source_sentence: 婆羅門等皆各答言：『聞。』
translation: The Brāhmaṇas and others each replied, 'I've heard it.'

source_sentence: 雲童子言：『即此身是。』
translation: The boy Yun said, 'That's this body.'

source_sentence: 婆羅門眾既識知已，更復歡喜，發大聲言：『善哉善哉！
translation: Knowing this, the brāhmaṇas rejoiced and cried out in great joy, “Splendid!

source_sentence: 善建立此無遮之會，得雲童子來受此供。』
translation: Well-established this unobstructed assembly, you'll get the cloud boy to come and accept this offering.'

source_sentence: 「時，祭祀德婆羅門女，善技之身，及諸童女，樓上遙望見雲童子端政少雙，
translation: “At that time the goddess Prabhūtaratna, the brahmaness Sudarśana and the other ladies of the assembly were standing at the top of the tower from a distance.

source_sentence: 見已喜歡，向四方禮諸天諸神，心自密念：『願此童子，論議第一，勝舊上座諸婆羅門，
translation: Having seen this, he liked it and bowed to the gods in the four directions. He thought secretly to himself:

source_sentence: 令我遠離此不善人，莫與如此不善之人共為夫婦。』
translation: Let me be far removed from this unwholesome person, so that I won't be married to such an unwholesome person.'

source_sentence: 時雲童子至於會所，圍繞三匝，繞三匝已，至於上座婆羅門前，美言慰喻問言：『仁者誦持何論？』
translation: When the boy Yun arrived at the assembly, he circumambulated him three times and after circumambulating him three times, he went to the superior seat in front of the Brāhmaṇa and said, 'Sir, what's the treatise you're reciting?'

source_sentence: 時，此六萬諸婆羅門同聲共答雲童子言：『仁者莫問我此上座誦於何論。
translation: The sixty thousand brāhmaṇas replied in unison, “Sir, do not ask me what kind of discourse the superior monk is engaged in.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 今此上座可是我家婆羅門法呪術諸論悉皆誦持。』
translation: Now, this venerable monk is the Brāhmaṇa of my house who recites and maintains all the treatises on the Dharma spells and spells.'

source_sentence: 雲童子言：『婆羅門輩！
translation: The boy Yun said, 'Brāhmaṇas!

source_sentence: 汝此上座，雖復誦念婆羅門家醫方技藝，但我師資婆羅門學，別自有法，
translation: Although you, venerable sir, may you recite the words of the Brāhmaṇas in memory of their knowledge of the arts and sciences of healing and medicine, my teacher is still a source of instruction for the learning of the brāhmaṇas.

source_sentence: 要須相問，汝等有論名先有不？』
translation: If you must ask each other questions, do you have a theory that names it as prior to existence?'

source_sentence: 時彼六萬婆羅門眾各共答言：『我等此名尚未曾聞，何況得有？
translation: The 60,000 brāhmaṇas then replied, saying, 'We haven't heard this name before, so how could it exist?'

source_sentence: 何況得誦？』
translation: How could it be recited?'

source_sentence: 雲童子言：『我師法中，教我有此一毘陀論，名為先有，我亦誦得。』
translation: The boy Yun said, 'In my teacher's teaching, he taught me this one Vedic treatise, which is called prior existence, and I recited it.'

source_sentence: 時彼大會婆羅門言：『請為解說，我等樂聞。』
translation: The great assembly of brāhmaṇas then said, 'Please explain it for us, and we'll be happy to hear it.'

source_sentence: 時雲童子，在於上座敷設處立，以梵音聲，誦彼先有毘陀之論。
translation: The boy Yun then stood in the upper seat, spread his outer robes, and with a Sanskrit voice recited the treatise on the Vedas that had previously been taught there.

source_sentence: 時會六萬婆羅門眾，歡喜踊躍，同聲唱言：『稱適我心，稱適我意，甚大歡喜。』
translation: The 60,000 Brāhmaṇas in the assembly then rejoiced and jumped, shouted with one voice, and said, 'It's appropriate for me; it's appropriate for me; it's very joyous.'

source_sentence: 告雲童子言：『汝摩那婆！
translation: He told the boy Yun, saying, 'You Manabha!

source_sentence: 今可為我作於上座，坐我座首，受我上座最勝之水，受我上座最初之食。』
translation: Now, you can make a superior seat for me, sit at the head of my seat, accept the most excellent water from my superior seat, and receive the first food of my superior seat.'

source_sentence: 時雲童子推彼上座，令向下坐，即於勝座，承最初水，受於先食，食稱意食。
translation: The boy Yun then pushed the superior seat downward and ordered him to sit down, took the first water from the superior seat, accepted the first food that came before it, and ate it according to his wish.

source_sentence: 食訖已後，隨其所須布施之具，依上座法，而為受之，其不須者，辭而不受。
translation: After he had finished his meal, he accepted whatever gifts he needed to give them in accordance with the teaching of the superior monk. If he didn't need them, he declined and didn't accept them.

source_sentence: 時祭祀德大婆羅門，心自念言：『我今建此無遮之會，不依聖法，所有一切布施之物，
translation: The great brāhmaṇa Āryadeva then thought to himself, “I shall now build this unobstructed assembly so that it will not rely on the holy Dharma for all its charitable activities.

source_sentence: 不依聖教。
translation: They don't rely on the noble teachings.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 此會達嚫所有一切布施之物，為雲童子不領我意具足而受。』
translation: This assembly understands that all the things they give are for the sake of the boy Yun who doesn't receive them with my full attention.'

source_sentence: 「時，祭祀德大婆羅門，長跪諮白雲童子言：『大德童子！
translation: At the time, the great brāhmaṇa祭祀德大婆羅門長跪諮白雲童子言,『大德童子!

source_sentence: 汝可受此我之布施一切之物，莫令我會施不具足。』
translation: You may accept all these things that I give as a gift, but don't let me give them to someone who doesn't have enough.'

source_sentence: 時雲童子，語祭祀德婆羅門言：『大婆羅門！
translation: The boy Yun then said to the Brāhmaṇa Avalokitêśvara, 'Great Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 汝善布施，眾事具足，非是不善，此無遮會無有闕少，唯我須者，我今受之，
translation: You are a good donor, endowed with all the requisites and not unwholesome. There is nothing lacking in this indiscriminate charity. I am the only one who needs it; now I will accept it.

source_sentence: 所不須者，徒取無益。』
translation: Those who don't need it will simply take it for nothing.'

source_sentence: 時彼上座舊婆羅門心生此念：『我久時乞願得如是布施之具，決望先取，
translation: The venerable monk then had this thought in his mind: For a long time I have begged you to obtain such an almsbowl, wishing to do so.

source_sentence: 云何今者為此幼歲摩那婆來，推我向下，奪我利養？
translation: Why is it now that this young man, Manabha, has come down here to push me downward and snatched away my profits?

source_sentence: 若我生來所有一切持戒精進苦行果報，是果報緣，生生世世，共此童子相會集處，
translation: If all the fruits of my practice of observing precepts, effort, and asceticism were to come into being in my lifetime, this would be the condition as retribution.

source_sentence: 為其奪我利養之事，報此怨讎，終不相捨。』
translation: For the sake of their taking away my profits, they'll repay this grudge and never abandon it.'

source_sentence: 阿難當知！
translation: Ānanda, you should know!

source_sentence: 爾時，雲童子者，我身是也；
translation: At that time, the boy Yun was none other than myself.

source_sentence: 祭祀德者，現今檀陀波尼是也；
translation: The virtue of sacrificial rites is the present-day sandalwood nun.

source_sentence: 時彼上座婆羅門者，即今提婆達多是也。
translation: The brāhmaṇa of that superior seat at the time was Devadatta, who is now Devadatta.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

translation: When the boy’s body was spread out, the earth shook in six ways:

source_sentence: 北涌南沒，中涌邊沒，邊涌中沒。
translation: The northern well goes down to the south, the middle well goes down to the side, and the middle well goes down to the side.
